org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.convert.xpath
Class AeBPWSToWSBPELXPathNodeVisitor

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.xpath.ast.visitors.AeAbstractXPathNodeVisitor
      org.activebpel.rt.bpel.xpath.ast.visitors.AeAbstractTraversingXPathNodeVisitor
          org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.convert.xpath.AeBPWSToWSBPELXPathNodeVisitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAeXPathNodeVisitor
public class AeBPWSToWSBPELXPathNodeVisitor
extends AeAbstractTraversingXPathNodeVisitor

This visitor walks the XPath AST and makes changes to it in order to convert it from a BPEL 1.1 compatible expression to a BPEL 2.0 compatible expression.

convertGetVariableDataFunction

protected void convertGetVariableDataFunction(AeXPathFunctionNode aFunctionNode)
Converts a getVariableData function node to a $varName node.

Parameters:
aFunctionNode -

convertGetVariableDataFunctionTwoArgs

protected void convertGetVariableDataFunctionTwoArgs(AeXPathFunctionNode aFunctionNode)
Converts the two argument form of getVariableData to a BPEL 2.0 XPath construct. The BPEL 2.0 XPath construct is either a simple VariableReference (varName + partName) or it is a PathExpr with two children: a VariableReference and a RelativePathExpr (varName + query).

Parameters:
aFunctionNode -

convertGetVariableDataFunctionThreeArgs

protected void convertGetVariableDataFunctionThreeArgs(AeXPathFunctionNode aFunctionNode)
Converts the three argument form of getVariableData to a BPEL 2.0 XPath construct. The BPEL 2.0 XPath construct is a PathExpr with two children: a VariableReference and a RelativePathExpr.

Parameters:
aFunctionNode -

convertGetVariableDataFunctionOneArg

protected void convertGetVariableDataFunctionOneArg(AeXPathFunctionNode aFunctionNode)
Converts the single argument form of getVariableData to a BPEL 2.0 XPath construct. The BPEL 2.0 XPath construct is a single Variable Reference node.

Parameters:
aFunctionNode -

createGetVarDataQueryNode

protected AeAbstractXPathNode createGetVarDataQueryNode(java.lang.String aQuery)
Given a String found in argument 3 (or ae-argument 2) of bpws:getVariableData, this method will return an AeAbstractXPathNode. If the query evaluated to an absolute location path, then it will be transformed into a BPEL 2.0 compliant relative path prior to being returned. Otherwise it is returned as-is (e.g. the query evaluated to a function call).

Parameters:
aQuery -

convertGetLinkStatusFunction

protected void convertGetLinkStatusFunction(AeXPathFunctionNode aFunctionNode)
Converts the getLinkStatus() function call to a BPEL 2.0 XPath construct. The BPEL 2.0 XPath construct is a single Variable Reference node.

Parameters:
aFunctionNode -

createPathExpr

protected AeAbstractXPathNode createPathExpr(java.lang.String aVariableName,
                                             java.lang.String aPartName,
                                             java.lang.String aQuery)
This method is called to create a xpath node node given a variable name, part name, and query. The result depends on the value of the query. This method returns null if it did not understand the query param.

Parameters:
aVariableName -
aPartName -
aQuery -

isPartName

Returns true if the given String indicates the name of a part (rather than an XPath query).
